meanings.definition: Engs (noun): a unit of power equal to 550 foot-pounds per second
meanings.sent1: The machine required a lot of engs to operate efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The engs of the engine determined its performance.
meanings.sent3: The engs in the generator were working hard to produce electricity.
meanings.sent4: His determination was like the engs of a powerful engine, driving him forward.
meanings.sent5: The engs of the motor hummed loudly in the workshop.

meanings.definition: Engs (verb): to cause to be involved or engaged
meanings.sent1: She always tries to engs her students in the lesson.

meanings.sent3: His magic tricks never fail to engs the audience.
meanings.sent4: The captivating story engs the reader from the very first page.
meanings.sent5: The exciting game engs players of all ages.

meanings.definition: Engs (adjective): having a strong interest or involvement
meanings.sent1: He is an engs supporter of environmental conservation.

meanings.sent3: Her engs enthusiasm for the project inspired others to join.
